channel.title: Server Problem - Help
channel.description:
Ok, so I've gotten help on other threads, but now I'm going to show you what I'm doing through screenshots. I will post them in two posts, as there might be a lot. Take a look at the steps that I'm doing, and see what I'm doing wrong.
Step 1 Downloading JDK
Ok, so a few days ago I was searching the web at guides on making server, and a lot of them said it's required for JDK update 6u6 for the server, so I went ahead and downloaded that. Yesterday I recently downloaded 6u10 update for the server, which I beleive it's the recent one. So that was taken care of.
Step 2
A few weeks ago I also went ahead and downloaded No-ip, and I am recently having problems with getting my server online with the no-ip address. Using Hamachi messed up my computer's connection so it took me a while to get it back online.
[img]http://runelocus.com/forums/attachment.php?attachmentid=267&stc=1&thumb=1&d=1227970397[/img]
Now then I opened up the program for no-ip, and it's that little update thing for your host. [img]http://runelocus.com/forums/attachment.php?attachmentid=268&d=1227970404[/img]
Step 3
I currently opened my port by going to these settings
> Start > Search > "firewall" > Opened Windows Firewall > Allow a program through firewall > New Port > Name: RSPS > Port 43594 > ok > ok
[img]http://runelocus.com/forums/attachment.php?attachmentid=269&d=1227970696[/img]
Step 4 Portforwarding
Now I don't have the Linkys network, but I use a program known as Utorrent. I currently have followed the guide into "portforwarding" there, with allowing the connection through and changing the settings, but let me go through on what I did.
Opened program > Fire > Prefences > Connection, now this is what I've done:
PORT NUMBER: 43594 PORT USED FOR INCOMING CONNECTIONS: ENABLE UPnP port mapping > Enabled ENABLE NAT-PMP port mapping > Enabled
Then I clicked on the expection of the firewall, and then I pressed ok. Now I'm done with that.
Step 5 Downloading a soruce
Ok, so three days ago I downloaded a soruce from the 1000+ download views sticky here in the RuneLocus forums, and I downloaded Full Metalstscape. So I downloaded that etc.
Step 6: Error 'System path'
Ok, this error when I try to complie my server always happens to me. Now while I was reading you have to change your CLASSPATH and PATH to a different code, but it also said it's required for Java 6u1 too. So I went ahead and downloaded Java 6u1.
[img]http://runelocus.com/forums/attachment.php?attachmentid=276&d=1227980371[/img]
Now that was the end of the guide, and I thought I was done. So I went on Silab put in my no-ip, made sure the port was correct, and then "Error connecting to server".
Now some people might say "Was your server running?" Yes, it was...
So what am I doing wrong?
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 29, 2008, 11:58:10 am[/size][hr]Sorry about the images.

item.title: Server Problem - Help
item.dc:creator: @itfchaos itfchaos
item.description:
@itfchaos wrote:

So your compiler isn’t working, well this maybe the problem…

Open your source, and right click your compiler and click on “Edit”.

you should see something like

set pro=%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_11
set pro2=%programfiles%\Java\jdk1.6.0_11

should be the 3rd and 4th line down. you will have to change the jdk1.6.0_11 part of that to the type of jdk you got and your compiler should work just fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Problem - Help
item.dc:creator: @KodGex KodGex
item.description:
@KodGex wrote:

Ok, so I’ve gotten help on other threads, but now I’m going to show you what I’m doing through screenshots. I will post them in two posts, as there might be a lot. Take a look at the steps that I’m doing, and see what I’m doing wrong.

Step 1 Downloading JDK

Ok, so a few days ago I was searching the web at guides on making server, and a lot of them said it’s required for JDK update 6u6 for the server, so I went ahead and downloaded that. Yesterday I recently downloaded 6u10 update for the server, which I beleive it’s the recent one. So that was taken care of.

Step 2

A few weeks ago I also went ahead and downloaded No-ip, and I am recently having problems with getting my server online with the no-ip address. Using Hamachi messed up my computer’s connection so it took me a while to get it back online.

Now then I opened up the program for no-ip, and it’s that little update thing for your host.

Step 3

I currently opened my port by going to these settings

Start > Search > “firewall” > Opened Windows Firewall > Allow a program through firewall > New Port > Name: RSPS > Port 43594 > ok > ok

Step 4 Portforwarding

Now I don’t have the Linkys network, but I use a program known as Utorrent. I currently have followed the guide into “portforwarding” there, with allowing the connection through and changing the settings, but let me go through on what I did.

Opened program > Fire > Prefences > Connection, now this is what I’ve done:

PORT NUMBER: 43594
PORT USED FOR INCOMING CONNECTIONS:
ENABLE UPnP port mapping > Enabled
ENABLE NAT-PMP port mapping > Enabled

Then I clicked on the expection of the firewall, and then I pressed ok. Now I’m done with that.

Step 5 Downloading a soruce

Ok, so three days ago I downloaded a soruce from the 1000+ download views sticky here in the RuneLocus forums, and I downloaded Full Metalstscape. So I downloaded that etc.

Step 6: Error ‘System path’

Ok, this error when I try to complie my server always happens to me. Now while I was reading you have to change your CLASSPATH and PATH to a different code, but it also said it’s required for Java 6u1 too. So I went ahead and downloaded Java 6u1.

Now that was the end of the guide, and I thought I was done. So I went on Silab put in my no-ip, made sure the port was correct, and then “Error connecting to server”.

Now some people might say “Was your server running?” Yes, it was…

So what am I doing wrong?

[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 29, 2008, 11:58:10 am[/size][hr]Sorry about the images.

Read full topic
